title: Fears for British backpacker missing in Cambodia
text:
Amelia Bambridge, 21, has not been seen for two days on the island of Cambodia (Picture: Facebook)

The family of a British gap year student who went missing in Cambodia after a party have made a desperate appeal for information about her whereabouts.

Amelia Bambridge, 21, was last seen by travelling companions in the early hours of Wednesday at a beach bar party in Koh Rong.

Her discarded purse was later found in the venue which is in a backpackers resort.

The 21-year-old, from Worthing in West Sussex, was due to check out of her youth hostel at noon today to leave the island with a friend.

Her mum Linda Bambridge is now flying out to assist in the search.

She said: ‘This is very out of character, she is normally so organised.

‘I don’t know what to think.

This was Amelia’s first big travelling trip after finishing an apprenticeship (Picture: Facebook)

Amelia was last seen by travelling companions in Koh Rong on Wednesday (Picture: Facebook)

‘The police have confirmed she is missing – apparently the embassy is closed until Monday.

Advertisement

‘There doesn’t seem to be any urgency.

‘Her friend is still there as they were due to leave the island today, but she hasn’t left because Amelia is missing.’

The Lucie Blackman Trust, which helps families of missing people, said in a Facebook post that Amelia was last seen at a party on Police Beach.

Her family and friends described the disappearance as ‘very out of character’ (Picture: Facebook)

She was wearing a lilac floral shirt and beige cycling shorts.

Relatives have accessed her Instagram page and posted an appeal for information.

The post reads: ‘Amelia has been missing for 2 days.

‘She was last seen at the police beach party in Koh Rong at around 3am, and was wearing a tropical print shirt.

Her purse was found discarded at a beach bar (Picture: Facebook)

‘Her bag was found at the bar where the party was and she has not checked out of her hostel or turned up to the boat she was meant to be getting to another island with a friend.

‘We are all very concerned, please share and message @hannahclrk or @georgiebambridge if you know or have seen anything.

‘She has a cow tattoo on her forearm and two cat tattoos on her legs, sometimes wears glasses and has curly hair.’

Amelia went travelling for the first time after finishing an apprenticeship at Brighton Hove and Sussex Sixth Form College.

Ryan Harris, 18, was part of a group travelling with Amelia after he met her in his first week in Cambodia.

The family and friends of Amelia Bambridge are desperately worried about her following the disappearance (Picture: Facebook)

He claimed that Cambodia police indicated nothing would be done until she was missing for more than 72 hours.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Ryan planned to link back up with Miss Bambridge on another island called Siem Reap after they parted company on a neighbouring island.

He said: ‘From my experience I would say it is out of character for her not to come back after a few hours and it is a small island.

‘Even if you go your separate ways after a few drinks you see people again ten or 20 minutes later.

Amelia with her mum Linda who said her going missing was completely out of character (Picture: Facebook)

‘She should have come back by now.’

Ryan explained that the hostel held passports to ensure customers paid the bill but that Miss Bambridge had not gone back for hers.

He added: ‘She hasn’t gone back for that or checked out which raises a red flag.

‘It is nearly 48 hours now, that’s a long time not to be seen on such a small island.’

A Foreign and Commonwealth Office spokesman said: ‘We are assisting the family of a British woman who has been reported missing in Cambodia and are in close contact with the Cambodian police.’
